title: Highly recommended
text:
Great accommodation in the most amazing setting. Very comfortable and so well fitted out. Everything we needed was at hand.
Great walking tracks, campfire, amazing views.
Lovely for groups or extended families.

title: Amazing view
text:
Go at sunset amazing views day and night
Good service very attentive
Food good with a number of extras

title: Too crowded
text:
They let way too many people in at any given time so extremely uncomfortable
Been to much more interesting ruins and less crowded

title: Excellent
text: This is a hidden gem tucked away from the usual tourist tracks, but not far. Really interesting food

title: Excellent
text:
Found this fabulous little place
Saw sign in Broke took a quick left
Food was great
View picturesque
The service was lovely

title: Where’s the mini bar
text:
Ordinary hotel nothing special
Good location although there are better on the esplanade. There was no mini bar. For the price pretty disappointing. On the TV a mini bar menu comes up with individual prices but when asked the only option is s package deal.

title: Good place for road trip
text: Driving from San Francisco to Seattle this was a great place to stop over. We just walked in no booking. Helpful reception, very clean and comfortable. Walking distance to great pub and away from highway.

title: Good food
text: Great little find. Comprehensive menu. Great drinks selection. Service was good. This place has a really good upbeat vibe and solid pub food

title: Via Rail you suck
text: The trip across Canada was a highlight of our trip. We broke trip in two parts. First train arrived in Jasper 36 hours late and the 2nd train 29 hours late. We ended up travelling through the Rockies in the dark both times. Via Rail do not keep you informed on what is happening, offer you inadequate meal vouchers if you are in the station and all they say it is because of freight trains. Even if you love train travel this trip is stressful and impacts on you trip SIGNIFICANTLY. I would recommend flying and driving over this trip or try Rocky Mountaineer.

title: Solid pub food
text: Popular large tavern. Extensive food and drink menu. We went Sunday night for $10 pizza and $5 beer. Good deal

title: Bad night
text: Recommended by locals. Ordered pizza for delivery to jasper park lodge. Told 20 mins delivery time. Waited over an hour and 2 phone calls later we got cold pizza. I’d try somewhere else

title: Do with a guide
text: Great experience to walk on floor of canyon. Pay for the tour as you get much more out of it than self guiding

title: Nice atmosphere
text: Good solid food and nice atmosphere. Beer good. Food solid but nothing out of the ordinary. Tried the bison ribs with Mac cheese both a bit dry

title: Ok
text: Everyone said had to go. Thought it was okay. Small selection. More sweet than savoury. Scones we interesting

title: Great Pan Pizza
text: Excellent choice. Casual but great pizza Chicago style. Highly recommended. Lots of locals were there.

title: Lovely atmosphere
text: Well worth the visit. In an area of a number of nice looking restaurants. Very interesting tapas selection, lovely service and great wine list.

title: Nice place for walk
text: Very interesting area with lots of nice little shops and places to eat. A few places to sample things.

title: Great steak
text: Lovely restaurant in a nice setting. Popular so may be worth booking. Great steak and menu generally. Good service.

title: Highly recommended
text: Well worth a visit. Very popular. Great contemporary Canadian cuisine. Was the 2nd place mentioned by concierge but definitely the best

title: Highly recommended
text: Only stayed one night but great location for Times Square and 5th Avenue. Easy walk to Theatres. Fabulous luxurious accommodation. Great sized rooms for NYC. Nice Gym. Quiet with blockout. Included the best continental breakfast ever.

title: Good location
text: 2 nd visit this time with family. Good location, nice rooms. But this Hotel has the best Concierge EVER. They make the best restaurant recommendations that are not full of tourists. Highly recommend Peter who sent us to the best places

title: Great vista
text:
Lovely view with 360 views
Tilt was great for those who want to
Quiet day we went so really makes a difference

title: Walking tour
text: We did the sky scraper tour. It was a walking tour in the freezing cold but really interesting and informative. Tours lead by volunteers, Michelle was great. Highly recommended

title: Solid
text:
Good Mexican with a twist
Service standard American
Casual and not large
Good location post Cable Car ride

title: good location
text: Good location with great local amenities. Apartment well laid out and good amenities but a bit overpriced for what it is. Gym very basic and room gets stuffy. Whilst wifi offered for free poor connections
place: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

title: Slow drinks service
text:
When I booked online wasn’t informed a set menu
Food was lovely but we couldn’t get a drink. Had to keep asking and even then light on

title: Excellent
text: Got allocated a crappy table by door, and we asked to move outside which was great. The food was exceptional as was the service.
place: Red Lantern Restaurant & Private Dining Room

title: Truely Amazing
text: We were looked after all the way. More than we expected. We arrived and were made to feel welcome at the Homestead. The walk was moderately hard but not too long each day. Sleeping out under the stars was amazing. Food and drink superb. Highly recommended for active people

title: Very good
text: Lovely setting out to beach. A bit disappointed you can't swim in sea. Choice of restaurants excellent. Staff very friendly. Very clean and well maintained. Could think about stopping music after 10pm.
place: Marquis Los Cabos All-Inclusive Resort & Spa

title: Good
text: Nice place for a walk around and see the architecture and the few sights. Lots of shop and galleries
place: San Jose del Cabo main square

title: A highlight
text: Attended a function at aquarium. Lovely setting. Animals amazing. But if you are not a fan of caged animals don't visit.

title: A nice surprise
text:
Looks like an average motel from outside BUT the rooms have been fabulously refurbed. The microwave and dishes a nice touch
Comfortable beds
On busy highway but didn't here a thing although we were out teh back

title: Beautiful
text: always amazing. A lovely to visit and walk around. park around the back much easier than at entrance.

title: squeaky beds
text: expensive for the quality of the room. mattresses the worse I have ever had in a motel. on arrival single beds had signs on them that if you used them you had to pay more. single bed squeaked all night. time to refurb the bathroom

title: Great trip
text:
Live locally and see it pass regularly
Was surprised at how cheap it was
Yes a lot of people in boat but you go on expecting that
Thought it was good value for money and nice to take visitors on a trip

title: Christmas at Crafers Hotel
text:
2nd visit
Great food nice choice. Service was prompt and good
Loved the steak and you have to try the cauliflower.
Lovely setting

title: Work Christmas function
text: Great restaurant. For a set menu the food was fabulous. We were off to one side so didn't disturb others

title: Solid
text: Nice little cafe. Limited menu but good food. Such a nice setting disappointed not a better outlook or a fire or something for atmosphere
place: The Wall in the Wilderness Cafe

title: Great
text: Worth a visit and at least one drink. The service was exceptional with great attention to detail, going the extra mile

title: Good food
text: Food and drinks very good. Nice range. Service was slow and we got our food before our drinks but may have just been the staff of the day

title: Alpine setting
text:
Good pub food, lots of choice
Staff friendly
Lovely alpine setting with raging fire but place is a little chilly so rug up

title: Amazing
text:
Amazing wood carvings
Lovely setting with fire and wine and whiskey tasting
Cafe quite nice as well with limited choice

title: Wonderful
text:
Easy to get to when staying in city
GREAT food and service
Funky place with a Lovely ambience
Well worth a visit

title: Fabulous
text:
Found on way to cascade brewery
Great little place, very busy
Good menu great food
Best muesli ever and great crumpets

title: Solid performer
text:
Stayed 3 nights over two stays because our tour left from here. Been modernised recently. Nice rooms we had a seperate bedroom and kitchen facilities which is always handy.

Great location close to all Salamanca highlights and supermarket just around the corner

title: Fabulous
text: Great location. Food was excellent and great Tasmanian service. Book to be sure you get seat, ask for window.

title: Well executed
text:
Easy to find
Funkiest ferry we have ever been on
Great way to get to MONA
Nice shops to visit whilst waiting to leave

title: Great day
text:
Plan ahead and consider booking in for lunch if you can.
Leave lots of time to wander.
Catch the ferry nice way to arrive
place: Museum of Old and New Art (Mona)

title: Plan aheah
text:
Book for lunch for your visit to Mona
Great location and view. We had great service. Food was excellent. Alcohol a bit pricey

title: Great location
text:
Nice hotel.
Good rooms with twin double beds. All the usual facilities.
The location is great for shoppers. We were right above Myer and next door to Pitt st mall.
Easy walk to Hyde park or the restaurants around the Harbour.
A bit odd in that reception is on 8th floor and you have to take two lifts to get to your room.

title: Great restaurant
text:
We read about this place in qantas magazine and were not disappointed.
The setting was fabulous, the food great. If you don't like traditional Indian food don't let that put you off. Great find

title: Great food
text: Very busy large restaurant but don't let that put you off. Nor the queues to get in. The food is great. Great flavours and really interesting Chinese.

title: Nice hotel but pokey room
text:
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great
My issue was getting a room with one single bed. I know I picked the cheapest room but I didn't expect a hotel like this to not flag better that it was a Single bed. The room was pokey. I did have a balcony. Could not open the safe without using a spoon for leverage, had to move furniture to use the full length mirror.

title: Surprised
text: Enjoyed the trip. Bigger than I thought. Nicely presented. Loved the amphibious vehicle. Great views. Well worth it. Nice cafe.

title: Excellent
text:
You need to book
Great table outside
Excellent choices on menu
Food great
Drink service a bit slow as they were busy, but they gave us a free drink to compensate. Nice touch

title: Very good
text: Beautiful food. A number of menus to choose from so gives you choice of price point. Good range of wine and price points. Waiting staff a little snobby. You can't always judge a book by its cover so don't assume.

title: Solid
text: On my own. Traditional pasta pizza Italian menu. Lots of choice, friendly staff. Good house wine. Good for casual unpretentious feed

title: Very nice
text:
We had six nights here in a 3 bedroom villa. It's not really three bedroom it is more like 2 bedroom and a hotel room separate from main building. Wouldn't be good if you small children.

The villa was fabulous, nice look out to ocean.

The pools were lovely. The staff attentive.

Our inly criticism is that not one pool is heated. As the weather was mild the pools were pretty chilly.

Ps you can't swim I the ocean either

title: You must do
text:
We did 3 day 2 night on Valentine. Our own boat with two cabins.

The boat was fabulous and the staff looked after us very well.

All the Criticisms in other posts are correct but the positives out weigh these
- yes it is a 3.5 hour drive with a stop off in crappy tourist place BUT the driver does deserve a rest
- the driving is madness, just don't look
- yes way too much food, not authentic Vietnamese but nothing really wrong with it
- yes there is plastic wrapped cheese but we have seen this elsewhere so think it might be more Vietnamese than you think

If you can afford it, do the private boat. Too many tourists in all the sites.

title: Great concept
text:
We booked and avoided a longer wait

Took other reviewers advice and asked for an outside table

Yes it was full and noisy but made us more comfortable than small and empty

Lots of choice, we tried lots of things

Well worth it
